25#include <sys/cdefs.h>
26__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_mocs.c,v 1.3 2018/09/13 08:25:55 mrg Exp $");
27
28#include "intel_mocs.h"
29#include "intel_lrc.h"
30#include "intel_ringbuffer.h"
31
32/* structures required */
33struct drm_i915_mocs_entry {
34 u32 control_value;
35 u16 l3cc_value;
36};
37
38struct drm_i915_mocs_table {
39 u32 size;
40 const struct drm_i915_mocs_entry *table;
41};
42
43/* Defines for the tables (XXX_MOCS_0 - XXX_MOCS_63) */
44#define LE_CACHEABILITY(value) ((value) << 0)
45#define LE_TGT_CACHE(value) ((value) << 2)
46#define LE_LRUM(value) ((value) << 4)
47#define LE_AOM(value) ((value) << 6)
48#define LE_RSC(value) ((value) << 7)
49#define LE_SCC(value) ((value) << 8)
50#define LE_PFM(value) ((value) << 11)
51#define LE_SCF(value) ((value) << 14)
52
53/* Defines for the tables (LNCFMOCS0 - LNCFMOCS31) - two entries per word */
54#define L3_ESC(value) ((value) << 0)
55#define L3_SCC(value) ((value) << 1)
56#define L3_CACHEABILITY(value) ((value) << 4)
57
58/* Helper defines */
59#define GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES 62 /* 62 out of 64 - 63 & 64 are reserved. */
60
61/* (e)LLC caching options */
62#define LE_PAGETABLE 0
63#define LE_UC 1
64#define LE_WT 2
65#define LE_WB 3
66
67/* L3 caching options */
68#define L3_DIRECT 0
69#define L3_UC 1
70#define L3_RESERVED 2
71#define L3_WB 3
72
73/* Target cache */
74#define ELLC 0
75#define LLC 1
76#define LLC_ELLC 2
77
78/*
79 * MOCS tables
80 *
81 * These are the MOCS tables that are programmed across all the rings.
82 * The control value is programmed to all the rings that support the
83 * MOCS registers. While the l3cc_values are only programmed to the
84 * LNCFCMOCS0 - LNCFCMOCS32 registers.
85 *
86 * These tables are intended to be kept reasonably consistent across
87 * platforms. However some of the fields are not applicable to all of
88 * them.
89 *
90 * Entries not part of the following tables are undefined as far as
91 * userspace is concerned and shouldn't be relied upon. For the time
92 * being they will be implicitly initialized to the strictest caching
93 * configuration (uncached) to guarantee forwards compatibility with
94 * userspace programs written against more recent kernels providing
95 * additional MOCS entries.
96 *
97 * NOTE: These tables MUST start with being uncached and the length
98 * MUST be less than 63 as the last two registers are reserved
99 * by the hardware. These tables are part of the kernel ABI and
100 * may only be updated incrementally by adding entries at the
101 * end.
102 */
103static const struct drm_i915_mocs_entry skylake_mocs_table[] = {
104 /* { 0x00000009, 0x0010 } */
105 { (LE_CACHEABILITY(LE_UC) | LE_TGT_CACHE(LLC_ELLC) | LE_LRUM(0) |
106 LE_AOM(0) | LE_RSC(0) | LE_SCC(0) | LE_PFM(0) | LE_SCF(0)),
107 (L3_ESC(0) | L3_SCC(0) | L3_CACHEABILITY(L3_UC)) },
108 /* { 0x00000038, 0x0030 } */
109 { (LE_CACHEABILITY(LE_PAGETABLE) | LE_TGT_CACHE(LLC_ELLC) | LE_LRUM(3) |
110 LE_AOM(0) | LE_RSC(0) | LE_SCC(0) | LE_PFM(0) | LE_SCF(0)),
111 (L3_ESC(0) | L3_SCC(0) | L3_CACHEABILITY(L3_WB)) },
112 /* { 0x0000003b, 0x0030 } */
113 { (LE_CACHEABILITY(LE_WB) | LE_TGT_CACHE(LLC_ELLC) | LE_LRUM(3) |
114 LE_AOM(0) | LE_RSC(0) | LE_SCC(0) | LE_PFM(0) | LE_SCF(0)),
115 (L3_ESC(0) | L3_SCC(0) | L3_CACHEABILITY(L3_WB)) }
116};
117
118/* NOTE: the LE_TGT_CACHE is not used on Broxton */
119static const struct drm_i915_mocs_entry broxton_mocs_table[] = {
120 /* { 0x00000009, 0x0010 } */
121 { (LE_CACHEABILITY(LE_UC) | LE_TGT_CACHE(LLC_ELLC) | LE_LRUM(0) |
122 LE_AOM(0) | LE_RSC(0) | LE_SCC(0) | LE_PFM(0) | LE_SCF(0)),
123 (L3_ESC(0) | L3_SCC(0) | L3_CACHEABILITY(L3_UC)) },
124 /* { 0x00000038, 0x0030 } */
125 { (LE_CACHEABILITY(LE_PAGETABLE) | LE_TGT_CACHE(LLC_ELLC) | LE_LRUM(3) |
126 LE_AOM(0) | LE_RSC(0) | LE_SCC(0) | LE_PFM(0) | LE_SCF(0)),
127 (L3_ESC(0) | L3_SCC(0) | L3_CACHEABILITY(L3_WB)) },
128 /* { 0x0000003b, 0x0030 } */
129 { (LE_CACHEABILITY(LE_WB) | LE_TGT_CACHE(LLC_ELLC) | LE_LRUM(3) |
130 LE_AOM(0) | LE_RSC(0) | LE_SCC(0) | LE_PFM(0) | LE_SCF(0)),
131 (L3_ESC(0) | L3_SCC(0) | L3_CACHEABILITY(L3_WB)) }
132};
133
134/**
135 * get_mocs_settings()
136 * @dev: DRM device.
137 * @table: Output table that will be made to point at appropriate
138 * MOCS values for the device.
139 *
140 * This function will return the values of the MOCS table that needs to
141 * be programmed for the platform. It will return the values that need
142 * to be programmed and if they need to be programmed.
143 *
144 * Return: true if there are applicable MOCS settings for the device.
145 */
146static bool get_mocs_settings(struct drm_device *dev,
147 struct drm_i915_mocs_table *table)
148{
149 bool result = false;
150
151 if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev)) {
152 table->size = ARRAY_SIZE(skylake_mocs_table);
153 table->table = skylake_mocs_table;
154 result = true;
155 } else if (IS_BROXTON(dev)) {
156 table->size = ARRAY_SIZE(broxton_mocs_table);
157 table->table = broxton_mocs_table;
158 result = true;
159 } else {
160 WARN_ONCE(INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9,
161 "Platform that should have a MOCS table does not.\n");
162 }
163
164 return result;
165}
166
167/**
168 * emit_mocs_control_table() - emit the mocs control table
169 * @req: Request to set up the MOCS table for.
170 * @table: The values to program into the control regs.
171 * @reg_base: The base for the engine that needs to be programmed.
172 *
173 * This function simply emits a MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM command for the
174 * given table starting at the given address.
175 *
176 * Return: 0 on success, otherwise the error status.
177 */
178static int emit_mocs_control_table(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
179 const struct drm_i915_mocs_table *table,
180 u32 reg_base)
181{
182 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = req->ringbuf;
183 unsigned int index;
184 int ret;
185
186 if (WARN_ON(table->size > GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES))
187 return -ENODEV;
188
189 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(req, 2 + 2 * GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES);
190 if (ret) {
191 DRM_DEBUG("intel_logical_ring_begin failed %d\n", ret);
192 return ret;
193 }
194
195 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf,
196 MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES));
197
198 for (index = 0; index < table->size; index++) {
199 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, reg_base + index * 4);
200 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf,
201 table->table[index].control_value);
202 }
203
204 /*
205 * Ok, now set the unused entries to uncached. These entries
206 * are officially undefined and no contract for the contents
207 * and settings is given for these entries.
208 *
209 * Entry 0 in the table is uncached - so we are just writing
210 * that value to all the used entries.
211 */
212 for (; index < GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES; index++) {
213 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, reg_base + index * 4);
214 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, table->table[0].control_value);
215 }
216
217 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
218 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
219
220 return 0;
221}
222
223/**
224 * emit_mocs_l3cc_table() - emit the mocs control table
225 * @req: Request to set up the MOCS table for.
226 * @table: The values to program into the control regs.
227 *
228 * This function simply emits a MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM command for the
229 * given table starting at the given address. This register set is
230 * programmed in pairs.
231 *
232 * Return: 0 on success, otherwise the error status.
233 */
234static int emit_mocs_l3cc_table(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
235 const struct drm_i915_mocs_table *table)
236{
237 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = req->ringbuf;
238 unsigned int count;
239 unsigned int i;
240 u32 value;
241 u32 filler = (table->table[0].l3cc_value & 0xffff) |
242 ((table->table[0].l3cc_value & 0xffff) << 16);
243 int ret;
244
245 if (WARN_ON(table->size > GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES))
246 return -ENODEV;
247
248 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(req, 2 + GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES);
249 if (ret) {
250 DRM_DEBUG("intel_logical_ring_begin failed %d\n", ret);
251 return ret;
252 }
253
254 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf,
255 MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES / 2));
256
257 for (i = 0, count = 0; i < table->size / 2; i++, count += 2) {
258 value = (table->table[count].l3cc_value & 0xffff) |
259 ((table->table[count + 1].l3cc_value & 0xffff) << 16);
260
261 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, GEN9_LNCFCMOCS0 + i * 4);
262 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, value);
263 }
264
265 if (table->size & 0x01) {
266 /* Odd table size - 1 left over */
267 value = (table->table[count].l3cc_value & 0xffff) |
268 ((table->table[0].l3cc_value & 0xffff) << 16);
269 } else
270 value = filler;
271
272 /*
273 * Now set the rest of the table to uncached - use entry 0 as
274 * this will be uncached. Leave the last pair uninitialised as
275 * they are reserved by the hardware.
276 */
277 for (; i < GEN9_NUM_MOCS_ENTRIES / 2; i++) {
278 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, GEN9_LNCFCMOCS0 + i * 4);
279 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, value);
280
281 value = filler;
282 }
283
284 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
285 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
286
287 return 0;
288}
289
290/**
291 * intel_rcs_context_init_mocs() - program the MOCS register.
292 * @req: Request to set up the MOCS tables for.
293 *
294 * This function will emit a batch buffer with the values required for
295 * programming the MOCS register values for all the currently supported
296 * rings.
297 *
298 * These registers are partially stored in the RCS context, so they are
299 * emitted at the same time so that when a context is created these registers
300 * are set up. These registers have to be emitted into the start of the
301 * context as setting the ELSP will re-init some of these registers back
302 * to the hw values.
303 *
304 * Return: 0 on success, otherwise the error status.
305 */
306int intel_rcs_context_init_mocs(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
307{
308 struct drm_i915_mocs_table t;
309 int ret;
310
311 if (get_mocs_settings(req->ring->dev, &t)) {
312 /* Program the control registers */
313 ret = emit_mocs_control_table(req, &t, GEN9_GFX_MOCS_0);
314 if (ret)
315 return ret;
316
317 ret = emit_mocs_control_table(req, &t, GEN9_MFX0_MOCS_0);
318 if (ret)
319 return ret;
320
321 ret = emit_mocs_control_table(req, &t, GEN9_MFX1_MOCS_0);
322 if (ret)
323 return ret;
324
325 ret = emit_mocs_control_table(req, &t, GEN9_VEBOX_MOCS_0);
326 if (ret)
327 return ret;
328
329 ret = emit_mocs_control_table(req, &t, GEN9_BLT_MOCS_0);
330 if (ret)
331 return ret;
332
333 /* Now program the l3cc registers */
334 ret = emit_mocs_l3cc_table(req, &t);
335 if (ret)
336 return ret;
337 }
338
339 return 0;
340}
